channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-7864] Building mvn site with Maven < 3.0.2 causes OOM errors
item.description: If you try to run mvn site with Maven 3.0.0 (and possibly 3.0.1 - haven't actually tested that), you get hit with unavoidable OOM errors. Switching to Maven 3.0.2 or later fixes this. The enforcer should require 3.0.2 for builds.
item.summary: Building mvn site with Maven < 3.0.2 causes OOM errors

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The patch changes the minimum required version of Maven from 3.0.0 to 3.0.2.
Same patch but generated so it will apply with p0.
Thanks - will handle that better next time. =)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12505373/HADOOP-7864.diff.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/409//console

This message is automatically generated.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12505506/HADOOP-7864.diff.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/412//console

This message is automatically generated.
Not sure what's up with Jenkins, test-patch.sh applies cleanly for me locally on an updated tree. Went ahead and committed to trunk and 23. Thanks Andrew!
